required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Multi-center Study to Investigate the Endometrial Safety of a Continuous, Combined, Oral Estrogen/Progestin Preparation (17b-estradiol [E2] / Drospirenone [DRSP]) and to Compare the Bleeding Pattern of Subjects Treated With E2 / DRSP With the Bleeding Pattern of Subjects Treated With E2 / Norethisterone Acetate (NETA) When Used for Hormone Therapy (HT) for 1 Year in Post-menopausal Women

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to investigate the safety of the investigational product for the lining of the uterus (endometrium).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in the DRSP/E2 Group With an Assessment of Endometrial Hyperplasia or Worse at End of Study (EoS) (1 Year of Treatment)
primary_outcome.description: The number of women who had a biopsy classified as 'hyperplasia or worse' at any time during the study. According to the protocol this endpoint was defined as primary for the DRSP/E2 group only.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Amenorrhea During Month 1 to 3 of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The women were to record daily in a diary, indicating 'no bleeding', 'spotting', 'light bleeding', 'normal bleeding' or 'heavy bleeding'. Women were considered to have amenorrhea if they had no bleeding and no spotting day within the given time interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Amenorrhea During Month 10 to 12 of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The women were to record any bleeding daily in a diary, indicating 'no bleeding', 'spotting', 'light bleeding', 'normal bleeding' or 'heavy bleeding'. Women were considered to have amenorrhea if they had no bleeding and no spotting day within the given time interval.

arm_group.description: One capsule [0.25mg drospirenone/0.5mg 17β-estradiol (DRSP/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).
One capsule [0.5mg norethisterone acetate/1.0mg 17β-estradiol (NETA/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).

intervention.description: One capsule [0.25mg drospirenone/0.5mg 17β-estradiol (DRSP/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).
One capsule [0.5mg norethisterone acetate/1.0mg 17β-estradiol (NETA/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Postmenopausal women between 40 and 65 years of age with hormone therapy indication (symptoms and need for treatment)
- Non-hysterectomized women.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Usual exclusion criteria for hormone therapy apply.

Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

click here and search for Bayer Product information provided by the EMA

results_reference.citation: Genazzani AR, Schmelter T, Schaefers M, Gerlinger C, Gude K. One-year randomized study of the endometrial safety and bleeding pattern of 0.25 mg drospirenone/0.5 mg 17β-estradiol in postmenopausal women. Climacteric. 2013 Aug;16(4):490-8. doi: 10.3109/13697137.2013.783797. Epub 2013 May 11.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Only non-hysterectomized, postmenopausal women could take part in this study. The women had to have symptoms requiring hormone therapy in the opinion of the investigator. An endometrial biopsy at screening was to show no evidence of endometrial hyperplasia or cancer.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 944 women screened, 661 treated. 282 failed screening: consent withdrawn (55), in-/exclusion criteria not met (209), lost to follow-up (3), other (15). 1 woman was randomized but not treated (own decision). 5 women completed the study but not study medication, i.e. they stopped medication early but remained in the study for final assessments.

group.title: 0.25mg DRSP / 0.5mg E2 (BAY86-4891)
group.description: One capsule [0.25mg drospirenone/0.5mg 17β-estradiol (DRSP/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).

group.title: 0.5mg NETA / 1.0mg E2 (Activella)
group.description: One capsule [0.5mg norethisterone acetate/1.0mg 17β-estradiol (NETA/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).

participants_list.participants: 394 women completed study medication. 398 women completed the study.
128 women completed study medication. 129 women completed the study.

group.title: 0.25mg DRSP / 0.5mg E2 (BAY86-4891)
group.description: One capsule [0.25mg drospirenone/0.5mg 17β-estradiol (DRSP/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).

group.title: 0.5mg NETA / 1.0mg E2 (Activella)
group.description: One capsule [0.5mg norethisterone acetate/1.0mg 17β-estradiol (NETA/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Body mass index was calculated with body weight and height measured at screening (BMI = body weight in kg/ body height in m^2).

measure.title: Years since last menstruation at baseline

outcome.title: Number of Participants in the DRSP/E2 Group With an Assessment of Endometrial Hyperplasia or Worse at End of Study (EoS) (1 Year of Treatment)
outcome.description: The number of women who had a biopsy classified as 'hyperplasia or worse' at any time during the study. According to the protocol this endpoint was defined as primary for the DRSP/E2 group only.
outcome.population: For the DRSP/E2 group only - Primary analysis set (PAS): All subjects from the full analysis set (FAS) who either had a biopsy result classified as ‘normal’ or ‘hyperplasia or worse’ after a year of treatment or who prematurely discontinued the study before Cycle 13 with a biopsy classified as ‘hyperplasia or worse’.

group.title: 0.25mg DRSP / 0.5mg E2 (BAY86-4891)
group.description: One capsule [0.25mg drospirenone/0.5mg 17β-estradiol (DRSP/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).

measure.title: Number of Participants in the DRSP/E2 Group With an Assessment of Endometrial Hyperplasia or Worse at End of Study (EoS) (1 Year of Treatment)
measure.description: The number of women who had a biopsy classified as 'hyperplasia or worse' at any time during the study. According to the protocol this endpoint was defined as primary for the DRSP/E2 group only.
measure.population: For the DRSP/E2 group only - Primary analysis set (PAS): All subjects from the full analysis set (FAS) who either had a biopsy result classified as ‘normal’ or ‘hyperplasia or worse’ after a year of treatment or who prematurely discontinued the study before Cycle 13 with a biopsy classified as ‘hyperplasia or worse’.

analysis.groups_desc: Exact 95% confidence interval for proportion of participants with hyperplasia or worse at EoS
analysis.estimate_desc: The number of women who had a biopsy classified as 'hyperplasia or worse' was divided by the number of women with an evaluable biopsy (i.e. classified as 'normal' after 1 year of treatment or as 'hyperplasia or worse' at any time during the study).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Amenorrhea During Month 1 to 3 of Treatment
outcome.description: The women were to record daily in a diary, indicating 'no bleeding', 'spotting', 'light bleeding', 'normal bleeding' or 'heavy bleeding'. Women were considered to have amenorrhea if they had no bleeding and no spotting day within the given time interval.
outcome.population: Per protocol set (PPS): All subjects from the FAS who had at least 75% overall study drug compliance and no major protocol violations

group.title: 0.25mg DRSP / 0.5mg E2 (BAY86-4891)
group.description: One capsule [0.25mg drospirenone/0.5mg 17β-estradiol (DRSP/E2)] per day taken orally for 13 cycles (28 days per cycle).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
